gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: These data have been created by the Joint Nature Conservation Committee (JNCC) in order to cost effectively provide high quality, analysis ready data for a wide range of applications. Data is supplied under the Open Government Licence. These data contain modified Copernicus Sentinel-2 (Level 1C) data processed to a surface reflectance product (Level 2). Processing used the following steps: reprojection to $projection ($referenceSystemCodeSpace:$referenceSystemCode), band sharpening to 10m (removing the native 60m ESA Bands 1, 9 and 10), cloud masking, atmospheric correction and topographic correction using the $demTitle. Images are named in accordance with the sensor information and processing parameters employed, delineated by the alphanumeric characters separated by an underscore (_). The granule identifier is displayed in each name as TXXXXX, where XXXXX contains the details of specific granules in relation to the Sentinel-2 tiling grid (https://earth.esa.int/web/sentinel/missions/sentinel-2/data-products). The relative orbit number is displayed in each name as ORBXXX, where XXX is the relative orbit number (https://sentinel.esa.int/web/sentinel/missions/sentinel-2/satellite-description/orbit). They have been processed to surface reflectance using the Atmospheric and Radiometric Correction of Satellite Imagery (ARCSI) software, v$arcsiVersion and reprojected using GDAL v$gdalVersion using a singularity image based on docker image $dockerImage produced by JNCC. Further information on the production process is available in this report: http://randd.defra.gov.uk/Document.aspx?Document=14199_SD1707Finalreport.pdf

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: OGL (OGL): Open Government Licence v3 (OGL): This data is licensed under the Open Government Licence v3. The Keeper of the Public Records has authority to license Information subject to copyright and database right owned by the Crown. The extent of the offer to license this Information under the terms of this licence is set out in the UK Government Licensing Framework. (http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/)

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Data Collection Time: $collectionTime ESA file name: $ESAfilename ESA_processing_baseline: $PROCESSING_BASELINE ESA_Level_1C_product_DOI: $PRODUCT_DOI ARCSI_CLOUD_COVER: $arcsiCloudCover ARCSI_AOT_RANGE_MAX: $arcsiAotRangeMax ARCSI_AOT_RANGE_MIN: $arcsiAotRangeMin ARCSI_AOT_VALUE: $arcsiAotValue ARCSI_LUT_ELEVATION_MAX: $arcsiLutElevationMax ARCSI_LUT_ELEVATION_MIN: $arcsiLutElevationMin Instrument: Sentinel-2 Multispectral Instrument (MSI) Spectral Bands: Sentinel2A (nm) 496.6, 560, 664.5, 703.9, 740.2, 782.5, 835.1, 864.8, 1613.7, 2202.4. Sentinel2B (nm) 492.1, 559, 665, 703.8, 739.1, 779.7, 833, 864, 1610.4, 2185.7. Mean_Sun_Angle_Zenith (deg): $Mean_Sun_Angle_Zenith Mean_Sun_Angle_Azimuth (deg): $Mean_Sun_Angle_Azimuth Mean_Viewing_Incidence_Angles (deg): Band_01_Zenith $MVIA_B01_Zenith, Band_01_Azimuth $MVIA_B01_Azimuth, Band_02_Zenith $MVIA_B02_Zenith, Band_02_Azimuth $MVIA_B02_Azimuth, Band_03_Zenith $MVIA_B03_Zenith, Band_03_Azimuth $MVIA_B03_Azimuth, Band_04_Zenith $MVIA_B04_Zenith, Band_04_Azimuth $MVIA_B04_Azimuth, Band_05_Zenith $MVIA_B05_Zenith, Band_05_Azimuth $MVIA_B05_Azimuth, Band_06_Zenith $MVIA_B06_Zenith, Band_06_Azimuth $MVIA_B06_Azimuth, Band_07_Zenith $MVIA_B07_Zenith, Band_07_Azimuth $MVIA_B07_Azimuth, Band_08_Zenith $MVIA_B08_Zenith, Band_08_Azimuth $MVIA_B08_Azimuth, Band_09_Zenith $MVIA_B09_Zenith, Band_09_Azimuth $MVIA_B09_Azimuth, Band_10_Zenith $MVIA_B10_Zenith, Band_10_Azimuth $MVIA_B10_Azimuth Software Info: : ARCSI. URL: http://www.rsgislib.org/arcsi. Version: $arcsiVersion using a singularity image based on docker image $dockerImage produced by JNCC. Algorithms: Reprojection uses OSTN02 for datum transformation. Band sharpening uses local linear regression models (Dymon Shepherd, 2004). Cloud masking uses FMASK algorithm (Zhu Woodcock, 2012). Atmospheric Correction uses the 6S Radiative Transfer Model (Vermote et al., 2006). Topographic correction uses the algorithm stated in Sheperd Dymond (2003). Atmospheric correction processes carried out in the Atmospheric and Radiometric Correction of Satellite Imagery (ARCSI) software and reprojection applied using GDAL v$gdalVersion. CEOS Analysis Ready Data for Land (CARD4L): http://ceos.org/ard/files/CARD4L_Product_Specification_Surface_Reflectance_v4.0.pdf

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: Data originally from European Space Agency (ESA) created using ARCSI v$arcsiVersion and GDAL v$gdalVersion libraries using a singularity image based on docker image $dockerImage produced by JNCC. Processing used the following steps: reprojection to $projection ($targetSrs), band sharpening to 10m (removing the native 60m ESA Bands 1, 9 and 10), cloud masking, atmospheric correction and topographic correction using the $demTitle. JNCC, in collaboration with Defra, Aberystwyth University, Satellite Applications Catapult and Airbus Defence and Space, have produced standardised data processing pipelines for producing Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 ARD currently being considered as datasets for approval in the CEOS Analysis Ready Data for Land (CARD4L) project.
